issues.title: change to IPv6-only *capable* resolver
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
IPv6 only resolver - A resolver that only has an IPv6 address and can only send queries to IPv6-capable authoritative servers.
IPv6-only *capable* resolver - The resolver we propose in this document which utilises that NAT64 by doing the synthesis.

issues.title: Make it unambiguous in the text that we are talking about *stateful NAT64*
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
comment from Gabor LENCSE 
https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/v6ops/LXXuGxJrBa61aH_rJ-UsG2xlyIY/

> In the draft, you mention *NAT64*. Seeing this, most people likely 
> think of *stateful NAT64*. A few (like me) thinks that it can be either 
> *stateful NAT64* [RFC6146] or *stateless NAT64* [RFC7915] ("officially" 
> called SIIT). I saw that you referred to RFC 6146, but I think it would 
> be worth making it unambiguous also in the text that you are talking 
> about *stateful NAT64*.

issues.title: 464XLAT should cite RFC6877
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
> I recommend the following change:
> 
>     [...] However, using literal IPv4
>     addresses instead of DNS names will fail (unless 464XLAT [RFC8683] is
>     used).
> -->
>     [...] However, using literal IPv4
>     addresses instead of DNS names will fail (unless 464XLAT [RFC6877] is
>     used [RFC8683]).
> 
> Rationale: 464XLAT is defined in RFC6877, and the use case is described 
> in RFC8683.
> 

from Gabor LENCSE
https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/v6ops/LXXuGxJrBa61aH_rJ-UsG2xlyIY/

issues.title: Improve wording on how the resolver will work.
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
from Gabor LENCSE
https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/v6ops/LXXuGxJrBa61aH_rJ-UsG2xlyIY/

> Perhaps the following sentence may also be improved:
> 
>     [...] This problem can be solved by
>     the iterative resolver converting IPv4 addresses to IPv6 by adding
>     the Pref64::/n prefix, which instructs the NAT64 to convert the IPv6
>     packets to IPv4 packets.
> -->    [...] This problem can be solved by
>     the iterative resolver converting IPv4 addresses to IPv6 by adding
>     the Pref64::/n prefix, and thus the IPv6 packet conveying the query
>     is directed to a stateful NAT64 gateway that converts the IPv6 packet
>     to an IPv4 packet.

issues.title: Use the words “IPv6 to IPv4 translation”
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
from Vasilenko Eduard
https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/v6ops/Kgjq9E0H58UClWxnSFl1m3OCwsM/


> In a few places you have “IPv4 to IPv6 translation” but looks like in reality you mean the opposite: “IPv6 to IPv4 translation”,
> 
> Because the connection is initiated from IPv6-only host (hence, “from” is IPv6).
> 
> Like in the case NAT64. “6” is first in the abbreviation because the connection is initiated “from” IPv6, not from IPv4.
> 
> If it is the case, then it is better to replace the order in many places over the draft.
> 
> As an alternative, you may not show session direction: “between IPv4 and IPv6” but it gives less clarity for the reader. A little more effort would be needed to understand the essence.
> 
> 
> The same is probably here: “the iterative
>    resolver will translate the IPv4 address to IPv6 to access the
>    authoritative server's IPv4 address via NAT64”

issues.title: Move the Topology figures from the end of the document to the beginning
issues.author: momoka0122y
issues.body:
from Vasilenko Eduard
https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/v6ops/Kgjq9E0H58UClWxnSFl1m3OCwsM/

> Could you move figure 3 (together with the whole section 5.2) from the end of the document to the beginning?
> It would speed up the reader understanding of the environment.
